Highly recommended for all Alaskans: wear a cloth face covering in public settings where other social distancing measures are difficult to maintain

Extends 14-day quarantine for all people arriving in Alaska from any point of origin (international or interstate). Provided on online version of Health Mandate 010: International and Interstate Travel – Order for Self-Quarantine

For all NE businesses. Social distancing: reservations only, cloth face coverings required of all employees, no more than 20 customers or 25% maximum capacity (whichever is smaller), at least 6 ft betweeen individuals and household groups, establish a COVID-19 mitigation plan. Hygiene: employer must provide handwashing capability or sanitizer, frequent handwashing for employees, employer must provide hourly touch-point sanitation. Staffing: must conduct pre-shift screening, no employee allowed to come to work within 72 hours of having a fever. Cleaning and disinfecting: must be conducted in compliance with CDC protocols, active cleaning immediately or shutting down for 72 hours if employee becomes COVID-19 positive with testing.

General: social distancing protocol maintained, develop COVID-19 mitigan plan for employees and customers. Capacity: groups are limited to household members only, maximum indoor capacity is 25%, no more than 20 tables outside. Operations: reservations only (no walk-ins allowed), cloth coverings required of all employees, disposableware and single use condiments, fully sanitize tables after each group, sanitize or provide disposable menus, hourly touch-point sanitization. Hygiene: must provide handwashing capacity or sanitizer, frequent handwashing required. Staffing: conduct pre-shift screening, no person can work if ill or within 72 hours of having a fever. Cleaning and disinfecting: must follow CDC protocols

Non-essential businesses can resume operations if they meet specified social distancing requirements, hygiene protocols, staffing requirements, cleaning and disinfecting. Retail businesses have same protocols, but also are encouraged to do entryway, curbside and home delivery, telephone and online ordering for contactless pickup and delivery, cashless and receiptless transactions. Personal care services also have specific guidelines (e.g., no people allowed in waiting area, one customer per staff person at a time, customers have to undergo a pre-visit telephone screening for symptoms consistent with COVID-19, customers must also wear cloth coverings).

Restaurants (but not bars) may resume table-service dining if they meet all healthy and safety requirements. In addition to requirements, encouraged to continue entryway, curbside and home delivery, telephone and online ordering, cashless and receiptless transactions, and having customers enter and exit through different doors (one way traffic)

Eases travel restrictions under AK0012 to allow intrastrate travel and outdoor recreation as long as only household members travel together in the same vehicle, adhere to social distancing outside of transport, using cloth masks if/when engaging with a third party vendor (eg, stopping for gas or food).

(quote) Any family member who is ill with COVID-19 must be immediately isolated in their home or permitted place of residence of isolation (quote). Details how people who exhibit symptoms of COVID-19 must not leave their dwelling within 72 hours of their last fever, and then individuals who have known exposure to indivduals who tested positive for COVID-19 shall self-quarantine for 14 days following the last exposure. Also refers to CDC guidelines https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/if-you-are-sick/index.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fhcp%2Fguidance-prevent-spread.html

No gathering larger than 20 people is allowed, which includes the minimum number of necessary personnel to facilitate the event, or 25 percent maximum occupancy (whichever is smaller). Gatherings including non-household members, cloth face coverings must be worn, whenever possible. Also applies to religious gatherings.
Gathering restrictions are extended, though no longer restricted to no more than 10.
(quote) In all gatherings that include multiple households, cloth face coverings should be worn by all participants (quote)

Businesses not considered critical infrastructure shall only engage in minimum basic operations and health measures shall include: screening and evaluating workers who show signs of illness (eg fever, cough, shortness of breath), require workers to not report to work, enhanced sanitation, requiring hand washing and sanitation, providing PPE as available and appropriate, prohibiting gatherings of workers during working hours, holding all meetings and conferences virtually when possible, prohibiting handshaking and unnecssary person-to-person contact, increasing physical space between workers' worksites to at least 6 ft, etc

Businesses may have in-person minimum basic operations but must have health measures, which shall include: screening and evaluating workers who show signs of illness (eg fever, cough, shortness of breath), require workers to not report to work, enhanced sanitation, requiring hand washing and sanitation, providing PPE as available and appropriate, prohibiting gatherings of workers during working hours, holding all meetings and conferences virtually when possible, prohibiting handshaking and unnecssary person-to-person contact, increasing physical space between workers' worksites to at least 6 ft, etc

Following businesses may begin in-person minimum basic operations: gyms, fitness centers, bowling alleys, body art studios, hair designers. Not all businesses under PID GA0012 can reopen under this order (i.e., theaters, live performance venues, and amusement parks are not yet allowed to reopen for in-person operations). These businesses covered under this order can only open if they follow the COVID-19 mitigation strategies outlined under GA0016 BusinessHealthSafety. Currently expires under the expiry date for the renewed Public Health State of Emergency declaration.

Explicitly lists out 39-point measures required for in-person dining services to resume (ie, goes above and beyond BusinessHealthSafety required for OtherBusinessClose easing). These include shift staggering, limiting contact between wait staff and patrons, requirements on sanitation between diners, food discard practices, etc.

Extends GathRestrictAny (PID TN0025). Religious services/gatherings, weddings, and funerals are exempted from the gathering restriction, but are encouraged to continue using remote services or postpone if possible
Eases NEBusinessClose, as long as they operate under the ERG guidelines

Extends closure of the following businesses: close-contact personal services (eg, barber shops, hair salons, body art and tattoo, massage therapy), venues for entertainment and recreation (eg, bars, night clubs, live performance venues, bowling alleys, arcades, concerts, sporting event venues, amusement parks, senior centers)
Persons are urged to wear face coverings in public places
Continues restaurant 50 percent capacity restrictions for 89 out of 95 counties
Eases StayAtHome (PID TN0017), (quote) all persons are strongly encouraged to continue to stay at home and to minimize in-person contact)
State of Disaster Declared. No clear expiry provided.
In effect statewide at 1159 pm on 20200320, coded to 20200321. Initial expiry is set to be 1159 pm 20200403, coded to 20200404
LastUpdatedNotes: Updated DateEnacted to 20200321 since it went in effect at 1159 pm on 20200320. Added initial expiry of 20200404 since its expiry was 20200403 at 1159 pm

PolicyCodingNotes: Mandates 14 day quarantine on individuals entering Texas whose point of origin or last departure was New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, or City of New Orleans. No formal expiry

Mandates 14 day quarantine on people arriving from the states of California, Louisiana, Washington and the cities of Atlanta Georgia, Chicago Illinois, Detroit Michigan, and Miami Florida. Expires when the state of emergency expires. Self quarantine order - specifies that the list of origin cities and states can be expanded going forward.
Extends gathering restrictions through the StayAtHome order to 20200430
Extends gathering restrictions through the StayAtHome order to 20200430

Extends closure of the following businesses to 20200430: gyms, massage establishments, tattoo studios, piercing studios, or cosmetology salons. Establishes list of essential critical infrastructure sectors, which omits in-person retail services and therefore closes those stores for in-person operations
Order includes extension of restrictions on bars and restuarants, which would have otherwise expired on 20200404.
Extension of school closure included in the initial StayAtHome.

Requires Texans to stay at home except for essential activities (including everything listed by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, plus religious services), supersedes all policies in earlier GathRestrict order.
Extends disaster proclamation. No clear expiry provided.

Establishes list of non-essential businesses that can reopen under guidelines, and only if they can operate through remote, drive-thru, etc.. (quote) retail services that are not essential services, but that may be provided through pickup, delivery by mail, or delivery to the customer’s doorstep in strict compliance with the terms required by DSHS (quote)

Establishes list of non-essential businesses that can reopen under guidelines, and only if they can operate through remote, drive-thru, etc.. (quote) retail services that are not essential services, but that may be provided through pickup, delivery by mail, or delivery to the customer’s doorstep in strict compliance with the terms required by DSHS (quote)
Calls for schools to stay closed through end of AY 2019-2020

(quote) every person in TX shall minimize social gatherings and minimize in-person contact. (quote) Page 3 of order, this order supersedes Executive Order GA- 14, but does not supersede Executive Orders GA-09, GA-b, GA-li, GA-12, GA-13, or GA-15.
Extends gathering restrictions to 20200516
Extends gathering restrictions to 20200516

Allows in-person services to occur for the following types of businesses if they remain up to 25 percent occupancy: in-store retail, movie theaters, shopping malls, museums and libraries. Golf course operations appear to be fully opened. Businesses should follow minimum standard health protocols by DSHS and should implement social distancing, practice good hygiene, etc. but is not expressly mandated. Face coverings are encouraged but not required.

Extends closure of the following businesses: bars, gyms, public swimming pools, interactive amusement venues such as bowling alleys and video arcades, massage establishments, tattoo studios, piercing studios, or cosmetology salons

In counties with 5 or fewer cases of COVID-19, in-store retail, dine-in restaurants, movie theaters, shopping malls, and museums and libraries can operate up to 50 percent vesus 25 percent of listed occupancy

Eases TX0008 for Louisiana (all travelers from Louisiana are no longer subject to self-quarantine) but maintains self-quarantine requirement for individuals that have traveled from specific states (California, Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Washington) and specific cities (Atlanta Georgia, Chicago Illinois, Detroit Michigan, Miami Florida). Does not provide formal expiry

Dine-in restaurant services can occur if restaurants operate up to 25 percent of total occupancy and for restaurants for which less than 51 percent of gross receipts are from alcoholic beverages (so effectively keeping establishments that are primarily bars under previous restrictions). EO expires 1159 pm on 20200515, so coded to 20200516 as expiry

Eases prior StayAtHome (PID of TX0014) to (quote) strongly encouraged to stay at home as much as possible (quote) and to be applied to people aged over 65 years. EO expires 1159 pm on 20200515, so coded to 20200516 as expiry. Makes the previous StayAtHome not a mandate.
